bill_title: prevent the enforcement of federal laws and directives related to firearms, accessories, and ammunition.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to prevent the enforcement of federal laws and directives related to firearms, accessories, and ammunition. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added to title 23: No state agency, political subdivision, or any elected or appointed official or employee of this state or of a political subdivision may contract with or provide assistance to a federal agency or official with respect to the enforcement of a federal statute, regulation, or executive order, which imposes a prohibition, restriction, or requirement that does not exist under the laws of this state, and relates to the sale, transfer, ownership, or possession of: (1) A firearm, or any component or accessory; or (2) Ammunition, or any component or accessory. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added to title 23: Any elected or appointed official or employee of this state or of a political subdivision who knowingly violates section 1 of this Act is subject to: (1) A civil penalty in the amount of $1000 for a first violation; and (2) A Class 1 misdemeanor for a second or subsequent violation. Any civil penalty collected by a court in accordance with this section must be deposited into the state general fund. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added to title 23: This Act does not apply to any contract requiring the provision of assistance in the enforcement of a federal statute, regulation, or executive order, if the contract was entered into before July 1, 2023.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
